pull_repo_desc: An Android library module to Mozilla's Speech-To-Text services

pullsbody:
Problem:
- Even if a `.noUseDecoder`  file is present, a `scorer` is still required. In implementations that do not supply a scorer file this will cause a critical failure.

Fix:
- If a `.noUseDecoder` or `scorer` file is present then `ModelUtils.isReady` will return `true`.
pull_repo_desc: An Android library module to Mozilla's Speech-To-Text services

pullsbody:
Problem:
- Even if a `.noUseDecoder`  file is present, a `scorer` is still required. In implementations that do not supply a scorer file this will cause a critical failure.

Fix:

pullsbody:
Related to: https://discourse.mozilla.org/t/android-demo-app-poor-inference-results/61348

`nshorts = mRecorder.read(mBuftemp, 0, mBuftemp.length);`
and
`mStt.encode(mBuftemp, 0, nshorts);` 
were beingcalled in the same thread in start method which caused missed voice data.

This PR fixes that running the local STT client in it's own thread.
pull_repo_desc: An Android library module to Mozilla's Speech-To-Text services
pull_commit_message: Run local STT in a different thread

pullsbody:
Related to: https://discourse.mozilla.org/t/android-demo-app-poor-inference-results/61348

`nshorts = mRecorder.read(mBuftemp, 0, mBuftemp.length);`
and
`mStt.encode(mBuftemp, 0, nshorts);` 
were beingcalled in the same thread in start method which caused missed voice data.

This PR fixes that running the local STT client in it's own thread.

pullsbody:
Fixes #30 Fixes https://github.com/MozillaReality/FirefoxReality/issues/2723
- Refactor some code to be reused across implementations, especially the code related to voice recording.
- Fixed threading and callback issues. We were still sending callbacks even if the speech request had been cancelled. Now a stopped request shouldn't notify anymore.
- Added utilities to Download and Unzip models
- Utilities to handle models, installed models, model paths, urls, check model availability, different model versions, etc.
- Improved general stability
pull_repo_desc: An Android library module to Mozilla's Speech-To-Text services

pullsbody: @andrenatal This implementation adds support for a GeckoWebExecutor based Http connection so projects already using Gecko can simplify the Http stack. The problem is that I get an invalid answer from the server but I cannot debug it so I'm not sure what's happening or why the request is not valid.

pulltitle: Call cancel on the network thread too when calling cancel on the service
pullsbody: Related to https://github.com/MozillaReality/FirefoxReality/issues/2723. When calling cancel on the service only the local thread is cancelled. Make sure we call cancel on both.
pull_repo_desc: An Android library module to Mozilla's Speech-To-Text services
pull_commit_message: Call cancel on the network thread too when calling cancel on the service

pullsbody:
I'm working on enabling R8 minification for Firefox Reality and found some problems with the androidspeech library (a crash if Opus class attributes are not kept or connection failures if httpclient dependendies are not kept).

This PR adds proguard rules that will only be applied on the consumer of the library

pullsbody:
Fixes #10


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: An Android library module to Mozilla's Speech-To-Text services
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #10.

_(Message COC002)_
